meanings.sent1: He spoke vaingloriously about his accomplishments, trying to impress everyone.
meanings.sent2: She strutted vaingloriously down the street, showing off her new outfit.
meanings.sent3: The peacock vaingloriously displayed its colorful feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent4: The politician vaingloriously promised to solve all the city's problems in a single day.
meanings.sent5: The knight rode vaingloriously into battle, believing he was invincible.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or exhibiting excessive vanity or pride in one's achievements.
meanings.sent1: Her vainglorious attitude made it difficult for others to work with her.
meanings.sent2: The vainglorious actor couldn't stop talking about his latest award.
meanings.sent3: The vainglorious cat strutted around the house as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: The vainglorious CEO believed he was the smartest person in the company.
meanings.sent5: The vainglorious student always had to be the center of attention in class.
